page.title: 09Employment in Newent
page.content: The pattern of employment has changed rapidly over the years since World War II and this has changed the nature of Newent from that of a market town to a modern town that is generally one of a residential and some would say a dormitory town with employment outside the area. Many people now work in Gloucester and Cheltenham and a significant number travel to Mitcheldean where they work in the large Rank-Xerox factory. Some work in local agriculture as in former days and the horticultural industry gives seasonal employment. The private and local council estates that are being built together with the local saw mill and ladder works are the major employers. There are moves to attract light industry to the area to combat the rise in unemployment.
